articles.title: Bizarrap & Quevedo Top Argentina Hot 100 Chart for a Seventh Week
articles.description: Bizarrap and Quevedo hold strong atop the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 chart for a seventh week as “Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 52” tops the ranking dated Aug. 27.
articles.content: Bizarrap and Quevedo hold strong atop the Billboard Argentina Hot 100 chart for a seventh week as “Bzrp Music Sessions, Vol. 52” tops the ranking dated Aug. 27. It moves into a tie with four other songs for the eighth-most weeks at No. 1 since the ch... [1052 chars]

articles.title: Argentina shaken by assassination attempt on vice president
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of Argentines descended on the capital's main plaza on Friday in a show of solidarity against a shocking assassination attempt on the country's vice president a day earlier, which triggered an outpouring of support in a country gripped by deep political polarization and economic crisis.

articles.title: Argentina Reels From Assassination Attempt on Its Vice President
articles.description: The man who the authorities believe tried to shoot Cristina Fernández de Kirchner showed an interest in a mix of fringe ideologies, including the far right, his social media showed.
articles.content: The federal police arrested Fernando Andres Sabag Montiel, 35, a Brazilian man who has lived in Argentina for more than 20 years. They recovered a gun at the scene, and on Friday, local media said they found 100 bullets in his studio apartment in a w... [861 chars]

articles.title: Health officials probe Argentina pneumonia cases; three dead
articles.description: The illnesses have been centred around a private medical clinic in the city of San Miguel de Tucumán, Argentina’s fifth-largest city.
articles.content:
Argentine health authorities are investigating a cluster of pneumonia cases from an unknown cause that has led to three deaths among 10 cases identified so far.
The illnesses have been centred around a private medical clinic in the city of San Miguel... [1197 chars]

articles.title: WHO monitoring cases of pneumonia of unknown origin in Argentina
articles.description: He first suspected Legionnaires' disease, which is caused by inhaling droplets of water containing Legionella bacteria, but tests have ruled that out. PAHO and the WHO are monitoring the outbreak and assisting local health officials with the investigation.
articles.content:
The World Health Organization is monitoring a cluster of 10 cases of pneumonia from an unknown cause in Argentina in an outbreak that so far has included three deaths.
The cases are linked to a single private clinic in the city of San Miguel de Tucum... [1786 chars]

articles.title: Gun Jams In Argentina Vice President's Assassination Attempt
articles.description: The Vice President of Argentina survived an assassination attempt after a gunman pointed a handgun in her face, before the weapon jammed.
articles.content:
The Vice President of Argentina survived an assassination attempt after a gunman pointed a handgun in her face, before the weapon jammed.
Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, who is facing a trial for alleged corruption during her Presidency from 2007-201... [2282 chars]

articles.title: Argentina VP Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner's attacker had stash of bullets
articles.description: Fernando Andres Sabag Montiel, a 35-year-old Brazilian, was taken into custody after he was caught on camera pointing the loaded gun in Fernandez de Kirchner's face outside her Buenos Aires home Thursday night.
articles.content:
The would-be assassin who allegedly pulled a gun on Argentina’s Vice President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner had 100 bullets stashed in his home when police raided it in the wake of the shock attack.
